III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person
Section contact
Description • (1) An agency shall develop a plan of visitation and family
time for each child in foster care consistent with the child's
service plans, as required by R 400.12419 and R
400.12420 to ensure the safety and well-being of the child.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Noncompliance with visitation plan.
Investigation Allegation was made the agency was not cooperative in complying
with the visitation plan for Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C.
Interviews:
I made three attempted contacts (twice on 9/2/25 and once on
9/3/25) with Respondent Mother. Messages were left requesting
a return call, and no responses were received from Respondent
Mother.
I interviewed Chief Administrator by phone on 07/01/2025.
Chief Administrator stated this is a Cass County case and
provided contact information for Foster Care Supervisor.
I interviewed Foster Care Supervisor by phone on 07/01/2025.
Foster Care Supervisor provided a possible contact number for
Respondent Mother of Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. Foster
Care Supervisor also provided contact information for Foster Care
Worker.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker by phone on 08/27/2025.
Foster Care Worker reported the children were initially placed
together 09/24/2024. Foster Care Worker stated Youth B was
subsequently placed separately from 10/16/2024 to 01/02/2025
due to Youth B's behaviors. Foster Care Worker reported Youth A
and Youth C were placed in their current placement on
10/08/2024 and Youth B was reunited with them in the current
placement on 01/02/2025. Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C are
placed together in their current placement.
Foster Care Worker described Respondent Mother as inconsistent
with visitation/parenting time. Foster Care Worker stated
Visitation Supervisor is responsible for coordinating and
supervising visitation/parenting time. Foster Care Worker stated
visitation/parenting time also includes the participation of
Therapist as well as the supervision provided by Visitation
Supervisor. Foster Care Worker provided contact information to
interview Visitation Supervisor. Foster Care Worker stated the
visitation plan is to be weekly for two hours, supervised in a
community setting. Foster Care Worker stated she would submit
additional information related to visitation/parenting time as well as
court orders providing the agency with discretion on
implementation of visitation criteria/expectations due to the
2

demonstrated inconsistencies of Respondent Mother meeting the
expectations.
I interviewed Visitation Supervisor by phone on 09/02/2025.
Visitation Supervisor stated she does not cancel visits, but
Respondent Mother must text confirmation of a scheduled visit by
8:00 AM on the day of the visit, or the visit will not occur.
Visitation Supervisor described Respondent Mother as
inconsistent in complying with the requirements for visits to be
completed. Visitation Supervisor stated she does not cancel visits
as she is not compensated when visits do not occur. Visitation
Supervisor stated a visit was scheduled for the day I interviewed
her, but Respondent Mother had not confirmed the visit by 8:00
AM so the visit would not be completed that day. Visitation
Supervisor reported historically, the children were upset and
disruptive when a visit was expected to be completed and
Respondent Mother would not show.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed ISP and USP documents with identified completion
dates of 10/22/2024, 01/16/2025, 04/14/2025, and 07/13/2025
respectively. Each of these plans included a visitation plan of
weekly, 2 hours, community setting, and supervised.
I reviewed some documentation from Therapist related to visits as
follows:
6/24/25 – Respondent Mother no-showed her parenting time
6/26/25 – Respondent Mother no-showed our individual session,
later stating that she’d gotten a new e-mail address but her phone
was broken, and she did not have the link to our session.
7/8/25 – parenting time was cancelled due to Respondent Mother
not confirming ahead of time.
7/9/25 – Respondent Mother no-showed our individual session,
later citing illness.
7/29/25 – parenting time was cancelled despite Respondent
Mother confirming that she’d be there because the case aide
reported that she was not at the agreed upon location when she
was supposed to be.
8/12/25 - parenting time was cancelled despite Respondent
Mother confirming that she’d be there because the case aide
reported that she was not at the agreed upon location when she
was supposed to be.
I reviewed the court order dated 07/18/2025 and it states in part
the following:
3

Respondent Mother is not following through with parenting time
and visits with her children are very sporadic.
I reviewed a number of notes related to visitation compliance with
some of the documentation as follows:
10/04/2024 Respondent Mother a no show for visitation
11/02/2024 Respondent Mother did not confirm visit / visit
cancelled.

04/01/2025 Respondent Mother did not confirm visit / visit
cancelled.
05/06/2025 Respondent Mother was a no-show.
05/20/2025 Respondent Mother was a no-show.
I also reviewed letters from Foster Care Worker to Respondent
Mother related to parenting time/visitation expectations and
procedures. These letters included the need for Respondent
Mother to confirm scheduled visits for them to be completed.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with Rule 421-1 per staff
interviews completed and documents were reviewed. The agency
has an acceptable visitation policy for compliance. There is
adequate documentation to indicate the policies/procedures were
communicated to Respondent Mother for Respondent Mother to
have and complete parenting/visitation times. Court Orders also
gave the agency discretion in compliance with the visitation plan
as determined by Respondent Mother’s level of
cooperation/compliance.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
